author: mmusich
body:
#### PR description:

When developing for https://github.com/cms-sw/cmssw/pull/39351 I noticed that if a `TkHistoMap` object is constructed not using a valid pointer to `TkDetMap` (which is fetched from the EventSetup), while technically compiling fine, at run time using methods such as 

https://github.com/cms-sw/cmssw/blob/6d2f66057131baacc2fcbdd203588c41c885b42c/DQM/SiStripCommon/interface/TkHistoMap.h#L47

or

https://github.com/cms-sw/cmssw/blob/6d2f66057131baacc2fcbdd203588c41c885b42c/DQM/SiStripCommon/interface/TkHistoMap.h#L48

results in a nasty segmentation fault and the user is left to scratch their heads as to why that happens.
In this PR I propose to throw at construction time if a valid pointer to `TkDetMap` is not provided.
I also profit to delay the computation of `TkLayerMap::XYbin` only in the case in while the underlying `MonitorElement` is a `TProfile2D` and not a `TH2D`.
Finally I add unit tests for the package `DQM/SiStripCommon` in commit e1cb31aabf20209f0381f80f02308ba7d5be39d9.

#### PR validation:

Relies on the augmented unit tests
